title: Domain 3.2: Given a scenario, troubleshoot common personal computer (PC) security issues.
content:
🛡️ Common Symptoms

  • 🌐 Unable to access the network: Malware may alter DNS settings, proxies, or firewall rules.
  • ⚠️ Desktop alerts: Fake antivirus or scareware showing constant warnings to trick users.
  • 🚨 False alerts regarding antivirus protection: Malware might disable AV or fake its presence.
  • 🧬 Altered system or personal files: Malware might rename, encrypt, or delete important files.
  • 📁 Missing/renamed files: Can indicate ransomware or malicious tampering.
  • 🔔 Unwanted notifications within the OS: Often from adware or rogue software.
  • ❌ OS update failures: Malware may prevent updates to stay undetected.

🌍 Browser-related Symptoms

  • 🔁 Random/frequent pop-ups: Classic sign of adware or compromised browser extensions.
  • 🔐 Certificate warnings: May indicate man-in-the-middle attacks or tampered SSL.
  • ➡️ Redirection: Hijacked browser redirects to unwanted or malicious websites.
